intro: Valeriana calthifolia, commonly known as the meadow valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Valeriana calthifolia is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in herbal medicine.
